DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this retrospective study was to determine the accuracy of femoral tunnel placement utilizing Redfern et al's radiographic method for anatomic femoral attachment during MPFL reconstruction in addition to the resultant outcome.
DOC.brief_title: Medial Patellofemoral Ligament Reconstruction: A Review of Technique, Accuracy, and Outcome
DOC.detailed_description: Reconstruction of the medial patellofemoral ligament (MPFL) has been shown to be an effective treatment for recurrent patellar instability, There has been some concern in the literature about the accuracy of femoral tunnel placement and the effect that it might have on patient outcomes. The investigators evaluated the accuracy of MPFL placement using an intraopetative fluoroscopy technique and to assess subsequent patient outcomes. All patients undergoing MPFL reconstruction using an intraoperative fluoroscopically guided technique between 2005 and 2010 were identified. A retrospective review of their charts and radiographs were performed and the subjects were brought back for a follow up exam, radiographic series, and Kujala questionaire.
DOC.criteria: Patients having undergone the MPFL procedure, starting January 1, 2005 through February 3, 2010 Minimum follow up of 24 months Pregnant women Under 18 years of age Previously undergone prior MPFL surgery Participated in any previous research studies involving the use of ionizing radiation (either radioisotopes or diagnostic xrays during the past 12 months. The participant should not volunteer for other research studies involving the use of ionizing radiation within 12 months of completing the current study.
